page.title: 03BUTTERLEIGH PARISH MEETING
page.content: Butterleigh is one of a few places left in this country to have Parish Meetings instead of a Parish Council. This only happens in small villages like Butterleigh.All electors can go to the meetings which they have once a year. They usually elect three people to act for them:a{chairman;a treasurer and a secretary.The chairman calls the meetings together and also receives letters.The treasurer looks after the small finances so that they are presented properly to the auditor each year.The secretary writes letters to the Mid Devon District Council for example.There are no Parish rates but they make money by persuading people to take part in money-making events like clay pigeon shooting. The money is given to the Parochial Church Council for spending on the village.
